Key Match Events: Tyrese Maxey snagged a turnover from De' Aaron Fox and hit a running layup to put the 76ers up 107 to 98 with 3:34 to go
The Kings went on a 15-0 run at the end of the game to win 113 to 107
Paul George had 30 points and 8 boards for the Sixers but scored none of those points in the 4th quarter
DeMar DeRozan finished with 18 points, 5 boards, and the DPOG Crown
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance
Coach Steve Kerr emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense
The duel between Kevin Durant and Giannis Antetokounmpo was highlighted as the key matchup
Post-Match Reflections: Keegan Murray missed the contest due to ankle soreness
The Kings stick around in Sacramento for a matchup tomorrow against the Memphis Grizzlies
Coach Christie took the team to see the Beam in person to celebrate the victory
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nick Nurse started Guerschon Yabusele (8 points and 1 rebound) to matchup with Sabonis at center
Doug Christie started Keon Ellis in Murray’s place
Ellis finished with 9 points, 4 steals, and 2 blocks
DeMar DeRozan’s read on the final inbound was incredible
